title: Staff Product Manager - Enterprise Data
content:
SeatGeek believes live events are powerful experiences that unite humans. With our technological savvy and fan-first attitude weâ€™re simplifying and modernizing the ticketing industry.
SeatGeekâ€™s Data Product teams are on a mission to leverage data to drive business outcomes for SeatGeek and its partners. We are looking for an experienced Product leader to join SeatGeekâ€™s team to help shape and execute our Enterprise data strategy and roadmap. You will drive development and growth of our enterprise data offerings, build out the vision and partner with internal and external business and tech stakeholders to deliver strong value to our clients such as the Dallas Cowboys and Baltimore Ravens. You will have a deep understanding of bringing data driven offerings to market and experience in the Enterprise B2B space. We are looking for a Staff Product Manager - Enterprise Data with varying levels of experience to join SeatGeekâ€™s R&D team.
What youâ€™ll do
Develop an Enterprise data product strategy backed by business cases with ROI and market analysis 
Define and shepherd the roadmap, prioritizing based on market needs and customer feedback   
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including R&D, sales, and marketing as well as client teams to ensure successful product delivery 
Conduct market research to identify new product opportunities, data collection needs, and trends 
Lead a team that is focused on the development and launch of Enterprise data products, including managing product specifications, pricing, product differentiation and go-to-market strategies 
Inform our data acquisition strategy ensuring we are collecting the right data for market needs & monetization
Develop data partnerships and sales guidelines to optimize revenue while preserving our highly differentiated data sets
Drive data utilization and growth by analyzing client feedback, metrics, and market trends 
Work closely with the sales & marketing teams to ensure successful product positioning and messaging 
Develop and track key performance metrics for the product and regularly report progress to executive leadership
Drive product innovation by staying up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technology advancements
What you have
8+ years of experience in product management with at least 2 years in a leadership role.
Strong business acumen with the ability to develop a strategic vision for the product. You ideally have experience setting and delivering on a long-term Data product vision
Proven ability to solve problems in an ambiguous environment with constant change
Experience working with enterprise clients and incorporating their business and technical needs into the broader product strategy
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Perks
Equity stake
Flexible work environment, allowing you to work as many days a week in the office as youâ€™d like or 100% remotely
A WFH stipend to support your home office setup
Flexible PTO
Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave
401(k) matching program
Health, vision, dental, and life insurance
Annual subscriptions to Headspace, Ginger.io, and One Medical 
$120 a month to spend on tickets to live events
Annual subscription to Spotify, Apple Music, or Amazon music
 
The salary range for this role is $175,000-$240,000. Actual compensation packages within that range are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, certifications, and specific location.
SeatGeek is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. As an equal opportunities employer, we recognize that diversity is a positive attribute and we welcome the differences and benefits that a diverse culture brings. Come join us!

demographic_questions.description:
We love live events because they bring people of all walks together. We strive to bring the same feeling of connectedness into our own organization by embracing people of all backgrounds because we understand that different ideas and perspectives power the innovation that is key to our success.

In order to better understand our efforts in this regard, we invite applicants to self-identify as to their gender, sexual orientation, race/ethnicity, and veteran status. Completion of this form is entirely voluntary and declining to provide this information will not subject you to adverse treatment. Any information that you do provide will be maintained confidentially and will not be shared with hiring managers.

SeatGeek is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us measure our own diversity and inclusion efforts and to comply with applicable federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity record-keeping and reporting obligations.
